availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Williamstown, Kentucky, landlord. Married to Cordelia E. Carlite Collins on October 11, 1837. Father of Lucy Ann Collins, Richard A. Collins, James A. Collins, and Rosette A. Collins. Tavern keeper in Williamstown in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Williamstown in 1850. Land lord in Williamstown in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 361B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 185.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 001490815, p. 43.
Find A Grave, "James W. Collins (1814-1871)," Memorial #118764180, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118764180 (accessed on September 6, 2018).
